title: Healing Ceremony - Wikipedia
cleaned_text: Healing Ceremony Healing Ceremony is a [song cycle](/wiki/Song_cycle) for [mezzo-soprano](/wiki/Mezzo-soprano), [baritone](/wiki/Baritone), and [orchestra](/wiki/Orchestra) by the American composer [Marc Neikrug](/wiki/Marc_Neikrug). The work was commissioned by the [University of New Mexico](/wiki/University_of_New_Mexico) for the dedication of a cancer Treatment and clinical research facility. It was premiered in the UNM's Popejoy Hall on June 11, 2010, with vocalists [Susan Graham](/wiki/Susan_Graham) and Matthew Worth performing under conductor Guillermo Figueroa and the [New Mexico Symphony Orchestra](/wiki/New_Mexico_Symphony_Orchestra). Neikrug specifically composed the piece as a therapeutic experience for listeners. [[1]](#cite_note-1) [[2]](#cite_note-NewMusicBox-2) Composition[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Healing_Ceremony&action=edit§ion=1)] Neikrug described his inspiration for Healing Ceremony, writing: I started thinking about people who get sick — not just cancer — but anytime someone finds out from their doctor that something is really wrong with them. I thought about the power music has over people; I wanted to write something that would change how your body feels — helping you calm down, handle stress, get in touch with inner feelings and inner thoughts. He added, "This is not a treatment, but it surely can put you in the right place." [[3]](#cite_note-HuffPost-3) Neikrug, a long-time resident of a Pueblo reservation in [Santa Fe, New Mexico](/wiki/Santa_Fe,_New_Mexico), was also influenced by [Native American](/wiki/Indigenous_peoples_of_the_Americas) culture, remarking, "I've known the [Pueblo] culture for 25 years, their sense of the earth, of their place connected to the earth — this is a huge factor in their way of looking at life. It's very powerful in feeling grounded." [[3]](#cite_note-HuffPost-3) Discography[ [edit](/w/index.php?title=Healing_Ceremony&action=edit§ion=2)] A recording of Healing Ceremony was 23, 2013 through [Entertainment One](/wiki/Entertainment_One).
